system.description:
Unfortunately, when any writing on a cursed scroll is even seen, the victim is immediately cursed. No reading is necessary. The GM must make up each scroll's curse. Examples of a few common curses include the following:

  • The reader turns into a frog (or some other harmless animal).

  • A wandering monster of the same level as the reader appears and attacks the reader by surprise (a free attack with bonuses).

  • One magical item owned by the reader disappears (the item is chosen or randomly determined by the GM).

  • The reader loses one level of experience, as if struck by a wight. (The GM should roll again for a first-level character to avoid unfair "instant death.")

  • The reader's Prime Requisite must be re-rolled.

  • Future wounds will take twice as long to heal, and healing spells will only restore half normal amounts until the curse is lifted.

Only a remove curse spell can remove a curse of this nature. However, the GM may allow the cursed character to be cured by a high-level NPC cleric or magic-user, who will demand that the character complete a special adventure or perform a worthy but difficult task.
